game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.json.JSONString

    public final class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.json.JSONString
    A Board represents a game state. It is a container for the HashSets of Edges and Nodes that make up the playing field of the game. Because of this, each board belongs uniquely to a Game instance.

    Each board contains a collection of Parcels that need to be delivered from their starting Node to their desired destination node. In order to do this, each game has a collection of Trucks that can pick up and move Parcels along edges between nodes.

    Boards are either randomly generated from a seed or loaded from a file.
    Author:
    MPatashnik

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BOARD_GENERATION_DIRECTORY
      Location of files for board generation
      Game game
      The game for this board.
      long seed
      The random seed from which this Board was generated: -1 if loaded from a non-random file.

      • getRandomNode

        public Node getRandomNode()

        public Edge getRandomEdge()
        Return a random edge in this board

      • getNodes

        public java.util.HashSet<Node> getNodes()
        Return a HashSet containing all the Nodes in this board. Technically allows addition and removal of Nodes to this board - don't do that while the game is running because things will break.

      • getNodesSize

        public int getNodesSize()
        Return the number of Nodes in this board

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(java.lang.String name)
        Return the Node named name in this board if it exists, null otherwise.

      • getTruckDepot

        public Node getTruckDepot()
        Return the unique Truck Depot Node in this board, to which Trucks must return before the game can be ended.

      • getTrucks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Truck> getTrucks()
        Return the trucks on this board.

      • getTrucksOnDepot

        public java.util.ArrayList<Truck> getTrucksOnDepot()
        Return the alive trucks on this board that are currently on Truck Depot node (an empty arrayList if there are no such trucks).

      • isTruckDepot

        public boolean isTruckDepot()
        Return true iff an alive Truck in this board is currently on the Truck Depot node.

      • allTrucksAreAtDepot

        public boolean allTrucksAreAtDepot()
        Return true iff all alive Trucks in this board are currently on the Truck Depot node.

      • getParcels

        public java.util.Set<Parcel> getParcels()
        Return the parcels in this board that have not yet been delivered.

      • getEdges

        public java.util.HashSet<Edge> getEdges()
        Return the set of Edges in this board. Technically allows addition and removal of Edges to this board - don't do that while the game is running; things will break.

      • getEdgesSize

        public int getEdgesSize()
        Return the number of Edges in this board.

      • isIntersection

        public boolean isIntersection()
        Return true iff there is any intersection of the lines drawn by the edges in edges. Used for GUI intersection detection, not useful outside of the GUI context. Has nothing to say about the non-GUI version of the board. Students: not Useful for Game.

      • updateMinMaxLength

        public void updateMinMaxLength()
        Update the Minimum and Maximum lengths of all edge instances. Called internally during processing. No need to call this after game initialized - it won't do anything.

      • getMaxLength

        public int getMaxLength()
        Return the maximum length of all edges on the board.

      • getMinLength

        public int getMinLength()
        Return the minimum length of all edges on the board.

      • getAIntersection

        public Edge[] getAIntersection()
        Return a 2x1 array of edges that have lines that intersect. If no two edges intersect, return null. Used for GUI intersection detection, not useful outside of the GUI context. Has nothing to say about the non-GUI version of the board. Students: Not useful

      • getWaitCost

        public int getWaitCost()
        The score cost of idling for a frame, per truck. So you are losing points at a slow rate constantly, you can't compute the optimal solution forever. Lower than any cost of travel for a frame, but not 0.

      • getPickupCost

        public int getPickupCost()
        Return the one-time cost incurred when a truck picks up a parcel.

      • getDropoffCost

        public int getDropoffCost()
        Return the one-time cost incurred when a truck drops off a parcel.

      • getPayoff

        public int getPayoff()
        Return the value of successfully delivering one parcel to its final destination.

      • getOnColorMultiplier

        public int getOnColorMultiplier()
        Return the score multiplier of successfully delivering a parcel using the correct color of Truck. Thus, the score value of an on-color delivery is payoff * onColorMultiplier.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a String representation of this board, including edges and nodes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toJSONString

        public java.lang.String toJSONString()
        Return a JSON-compliant version of toString(). A full serialized version of the board, including: > Seed > Cost constants > Nodes > Edges > Trucks > Parcels
        Specified by:
        toJSONString in interface org.json.JSONString
        Returns:
        A strictly syntactically correct JSON text.
